content.definition: An endovascular device combining a metallic stent skeleton with a fabric or polymer covering (ePTFE or polyester) that excludes flow from the vessel wall. Used for aneurysm exclusion, arterial rupture, pseudoaneurysm, AV fistula, and lesions where bare metal stent may fail due to recoil or dissection.
clinical_pearls: Viabahn most commonly used peripheral covered stent
May be useful for 'bail-out' during complicated angioplasty
